1592851726_14cTEgRAd2nzUgLHkWNXwJ4E8Ue5m.body:
It depends on your homeserver implementation. [Synapse](https://github.com/matrix-org/synapse), by default, will set a limit 10MB, but you can set it to whatever limit you want. You'll also want to make sure your webserver's (e.g nginx) file upload limit isn't too small either.

If you're not running your own server, then you'll need to consult the person/people who are.

But Riot *itself* does not impose a limit.

1592851444_14cTEgRAd2nzUgLHkWNXwJ4E8Ue5m.body:
1-1 WebRTC calls? Yes, (other than the Riot mobile clients), I believe so.

However if you're talking about Jitsi calls, those can just be taken from any browser - just navigate to the https://jitsi.riot.im/xxx URL.

You can also download and run your own copy of Riot, or build it [from source](https://github.com/vector-im/riot-web) to avoid what you consider insecure js :)
